data.title: Senior Sales Manager (all genders)
data.description:
READY TO UNLEASH THE POWER OF OPEN FINANCE WITH SMART DATA SOLUTIONS?

Built on 11 years of extensive experience in Europe's open banking landscape Qwist is committed to innovation, financial independence, and making complex topics simple. Driven by the belief in 'data for good,' Qwist advocates for a more open and inclusive, regulated data landscape, benefiting consumers and businesses alike. Qwist employs 80 + people in 4 countries.

Join our team and be part of empowering everyone to access fair and transparent financial services! Get ready to make a significant impact in the fintech world as we revolutionize the way individuals interact with and benefit from financial solutions.

About the position:

Department: Commercial
Team: Sales DE, AT
Locations: Germany
Remote status: Hybrid
Number of positions: 1

This position follows a hybrid working schedule with semi-regular in-person events and meetings onsite. We have 3 offices in Germany; one in the beautiful harbor city of Hamburg (Germany), the second in the Bavarian capital Munchen (Germany), and the third one in the German capital Berlin (HQ). We come together in Berlin a minimum of twice a year to celebrate our successes together.

Tasks

What you will be doing

This highly visible role as Senior Sales Manager (all genders) will enable you to be a key player in our commercial team and create a direct impact on the success of Qwist. You will build on your expertise in acquiring and building long-lasting, sustainable customer relationships, connect and continuously communicate with senior executives within the financial industry to understand their most pressing issues, and come up with strategies to help solve them.

  • Acquire & Close. Due to your standalone expertise in financial service and SaaS sales, you‚Äôll expand the reach of Qwist in the market and attract new customers and partnerships together with the leadership body of Qwist, as well as your colleagues in your Commercial team and in Marketing, Product, Sales Operations as well as Legal & Compliance. You are an expert in enterprise sales and know how to manage a customer to close contracts effectively.
  • Connect & Strategize. The relationships with our clients are built on long-term trust and success and you will contribute to an elevated sales strategy that allows us to detect the needs of customers even quicker. You are responsible for translating them together with our product and implementation teams and impact the product strategy as an ambassador of your clients.
  • Reporting & Monitoring. You know your clients best and this doesn‚Äôt stop at their needs and contract details but you will also ensure that our contracts and pricing reflect our KPI requirements. You are also a key contributor to our revenue forecasting and sales reporting efforts.
  • Exposure. You manage the entire complex sales cycle, which includes presenting to C-level executives of (potential) partners regularly as well as evangelizing our vision through product demonstration, in-market events, and pre-sales workshops.

This role requires travel to visit customers and attend industry-specific conferences and events. You are expected to independently decide when, how, and where you will travel, as well as how often.

Requirements

What you bring to the team

  • Experience & Tech Savviness. Current experience within a B2B SaaS (or IaaS, PaaS) Sales organization, ideally serving financial services.
  • Network & Relationships. You‚Äôve been effectively optimizing your set of internal and external networks and know how to leverage C-level relationships which elevates your ability to negotiate and close complex deals.
  • Communication & Presentation. Thanks to your impeccable communication and interpersonal skills, you not only can build trusted relationships quickly but also know how to introduce complex digital products.
  • Independence & Ownership. You bring a strong team-oriented work philosophy while being perfectly comfortable and taking on projects and work streams on your own and driving them to success.
  • You want to be successful. And you want to work with products and teams that strive to be the best in the market.
  • Last but not least: You are business fluent in German (as you work with our clients in the DACH region) and in English.

Benefits

Why Qwist?

  • Work with a true open banking pioneer and witness the revolution from open banking to open finance and beyond. Work with colleagues with years of experience in the industry and a true passion and vision for the future of open banking.
  • Healthy work-life balance: Time is precious. Make it count. We enable all our employees to organize their living and working hours flexibly, making it possible to combine personal life with work life!
  • We are ever-evolving and so are you. We have business goals (OKRs) but also personal development goals. Our formalized bi-annual feedback process, regular Engagement checks, and personal development budget are available to make sure that we grow together and find everyone's perfect spot at the table.
  • You will become part of a cross-functional environment where you will be empowered through ownership and collaboration;
  • A relocation package and/or visa support for those who need it
  • While we offer you the opportunity to work at our Berlin, Munich, and Hamburg offices with all its amenities, we have a distributed working style, with semi-regular in-person events and meetings. Productive at home? So are we.

Don‚Äôt meet every single requirement? At Qwist we value diverse perspectives and experience. If you are excited about this role but your experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles!

ABOUT US

Qwist is a pioneer in the Open Banking and Finance sector, dedicated to enabling our customer base to drive business value based on data.
As a market leader in the four key European markets of Germany, Austria, Spain, and Portugal, we proudly serve top-tier banks, leading e-commerce players, innovative FinTechs, and other digital businesses and empower them to unlock the value of their data.

Qwist is a regulated payment institution under the Payment Services Supervision Act (Zahlungsdiensteaufsichtsgesetz ‚Äì ZAG) and offers seamless solutions for business expansion and risk mitigation through intelligent automation.

Challenge yourself and join us in our purpose to unleash the power of open finance with smart data solutions!

data.title: Senior PR & Communications Manager
data.description:
We are Klim, a Berlin-based clean-tech company revolutionizing climate protection by scaling regenerative agriculture in Germany and Europe.

We have launched the world‚Äôs first digital platform for regenerative agriculture, which is already being utilized by thousands of farmers. By marketing the associated climate protection services to companies, primarily in the food industry, we provide financial compensation to farmers for their regenerative practices and offer high-quality advisory services.

Supported by leading investors, including Atlantic Food Labs, Ananda Impact Ventures, and AgFunder, we are now expanding our team and seeking a Junior Marketing Manager to help us continually improve our digital product.

Tasks

As our Senior PR & Communications Manager, you will work closely with the Marketing and the Leadership Team.

Your tasks will include:

  • Develop and execute comprehensive PR and communication strategies to promote the company's brand, products, and initiatives.
  • Cultivate and maintain relationships with media outlets, journalists, bloggers, and influencers to secure press coverage and media placements.
  • Create compelling press releases, media pitches, and other communication materials to effectively communicate key messages and news announcements.
  • Oversee the development and maintenance of press lists, media databases, and communication assets.
  • Organize and coordinate press events, media interviews, and press conferences.
  • Organize and manage events, including logistics, promotion, and attendee engagement.
  • Monitor media coverage and industry trends, and provide timely insights and recommendations to management.
  • Coordinate our executive positioning initiatives.
  • Measure and analyze the effectiveness of PR and communication campaigns, and provide regular reports to stakeholders.

Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in Communications, Public Relations, Journalism, Marketing, or related field.
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience in PR, corporate communications, or related field, with a proven track record of successful PR campaigns and media placements.
  • Strong media relations skills, with established contacts in relevant media outlets and industries.
  • Proven experience in developing and executing PR and communication strategies that drive brand awareness and engagement.
  • Experience in event management and executive positioning.
  • Native German and fluent English speaker, with excellent written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to craft compelling press releases, pitches, and other communication materials.
  • Passion for sustainability and climate protection. Knowledge of (regenerative) agriculture is a plus
  • Creative mindset with the ability to think outside the box.Strong team player with a positive attitude and curiosity to learn.

What you need to succeed in this role

  • You must be comfortable working in a small team and independently
  • You're not afraid of doing hands-on work when required
  • You enjoy the challenges and rewards of working in a startup environment.
  • You enjoy working cross-functionally and are comfortable communicating with developers, designers and farmers

If you do not satisfy all these requirements and qualifications, please do not hesitate to apply - you might still be the perfect fit!

Benefits

Opportunity: Be part of our journey from the very beginning, working on an equal footing with the leadership team to build a new company

Impact: Make a daily and active contribution to combating climate change, promoting consumer education, and fostering fair conditions for our climate-conscious farmers

Autonomy: Take ownership of your projects and enjoy a high degree of creative freedom

Competitive package: Receive a competitive salary and have the opportunity to participate in our VSIP program

Flexible work model: At Klim, we foster a flexible, hybrid work approach and facilitate remote work (within the EU). It is advantageous for this role if you live in Berlin or can be present in our office on a regular basis

Additional benefits: We offer membership in the Urban Sports Club, team lunches (if in Berlin) and regular team events.

We are looking forward to meeting you!

At Klim, we place great value on equal opportunities. We believe that an outstanding work environment should reflect diversity of backgrounds, talents and thoughts. Together, we grow as a team based on our individual strengths. Every personnel decision is made solely on the basis of qualifications, performance and the requirements of the company.

Hey! We're numa. We're a dynamic, diverse hospitality brand that's offering uniquely designed apartments for the modern traveler. We specialize in the beauty of convenience and the delight of a design, with a totally digital guest experience and properties designed with intention. 

Numa properties are located in the most exciting and vibrant neighbourhoods across Europe. ABOUT THE ROLE

We are seeking a Junior ICT Technician to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for the installation of digital key systems, assembly of door fittings, and the installation of various electronic devices such as CCTV cameras, access points, and more. 

  • Install digital key systems in residential and commercial properties, ensuring proper functionality and security.
  • Assemble and install door fittings, including locks, handles, and hinges, following company guidelines and industry standards.
  • Install and configure electronic devices, including CCTV cameras, access points, and other related equipment, ensuring proper connectivity and functionality.
  • Perform other small electrical activities, such as wiring, troubleshooting, and repairs, as required.
  • Manage stock of hardware and materials, ensuring an adequate supply for ongoing projects.
  • Dispatch hardware to various locations, coordinating with the team and ensuring timely delivery.
  • Maintain accurate documentation of installation activities, including project details, materials used, and any issues encountered.
  • Adhere to project schedules and timelines, ensuring the fulfilment of time plans and meeting company standards for project closure.
  • Demonstrate a high level of personal responsibility, taking ownership of assigned tasks and projects.
  • Execute tasks on short notice independently and with high quality and precision.
  • Show interest in network technology and stay updated on the latest industry trends and advancements.
  • Collaborate with team members and provide support as needed.

ABOUT YOU

  • Minimum of 2 years of experience as a locksmith, electrician, or mechatronics specialist.
  • At least B2 level German and fluent English language skills are a must 
  • Work experience in the fields of locksmithing, electrical work, or mechatronics is highly preferred.
  • Strong interest and knowledge in network technology.
  • High level of personal responsibility and attention to detail.
  • Ability to work independently and execute tasks efficiently with minimal supervision.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot technical issues.
  • Excellent time management skills and the ability to meet project deadlines.
  • Good communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with team members.

data.title: PR Manager for Germany
data.description:
A better internet, where privacy is the default, is possible. Building this better internet might seem daunting or even unthinkable, but at Proton, this is what we do every day.

Proton was founded in 2014 by a group of scientists who met at the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN). Our first product, Proton Mail, is now the world's largest encrypted email service. Subsequent Proton products, such as Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, and Proton Drive, give our users full control over how and with whom their data is shared.

Today, Proton makes privacy universally accessible. Journalists from outlets like The Guardian and The New York Times, some of the world's largest organizations, and people in more than 180 countries have signed up for over 70 million accounts. Our diverse and dynamic team is made up of more than 400 members representing over 40 different nationalities. While we are based in Geneva, Switzerland, we have offices in Zurich, Prague, London, Vilnius, Skopje, Taipei, and many more employees working remotely around the world.

Join one of Europe's fastest-growing companies to help us solve challenging problems and build new products that will reach hundreds of millions of people. We want to create more than just one of the world's most impactful tech companies; we want to create a new internet that serves the interests of all people. We need you, your voice, your ideas, and your ambition to make it happen.

Purpose of the role

As the Germany Public Relations Manager at Proton, you're stepping into the dynamic world of cutting-edge technology, representing one of the foremost tech companies globally. Your mission? To catapult Proton's suite of products‚Äîthink encrypted email, calendar, drive storage, VPN, and password manager‚Äîinto the limelight. Beyond product promotion, you'll be the architect of Proton's image, orchestrating profiles and interviews in top-tier media outlets. 

What you will do

This isn't a 9-to-5; it's a chance to sculpt Proton's narrative in Germany. You'll concoct innovative communications campaigns alongside Proton's brain trust‚Äîproduct, engineering, content, social, marketing, and public policy teams. Your mission? Propel Proton's product suite into the stratosphere while securing Proton's status as the go-to authority on internet privacy in German media.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Spearhead integrated communications campaigns, aligning with Proton's product roadmap and commercial objectives.
  • Craft compelling headlines in German media, weaving Proton's narrative seamlessly into the privacy discourse.
  • Map and cultivate relationships with German media powerhouses, positioning Proton at the forefront of tech conversations.
  • Champion Proton's public policy stances through targeted media coverage on issues like antitrust, encryption, and data protection.
  • Secure speaker slots at conferences and events, amplifying Proton's voice in tech spheres.
  • Swiftly respond to media inquiries, safeguarding Proton's reputation through adept crisis management.

Job requirements

  • Minimum five years in communications or PR, ideally with a tech-centric agency or in-house at a tech powerhouse.
  • Expertise in cultivating relationships with journalists and donning the spokesperson mantle for the company
  • Battle-tested in crisis management, juggling multiple high-paced projects with finesse.
  • Fluent in both German and English, you'll seamlessly navigate the linguistic landscape.

Why should you join Proton?

  • Be part of a movement - Proton is not just a product or service but a community-driven movement united by a shared vision of online freedom. Our services are open source, audited, and supported by community contributions. We give back to our community by maintaining core encryption libraries and by supporting other organizations furthering the same goals as us. Proton is free, open source, neutral, independent, and community first, while remaining financially sustainable.
  • Work with smart and dedicated people - Our team is diverse, collaborative, and tight-knit with people coming from all walks of life, including many of the world's top academic institutions and organizations, such as MIT, Harvard, Stanford, Caltech, Cambridge, and ETH.
  • Join a strong brand - Our encrypted email service - Proton Mail - has grown to be a staple of online security and privacy. Proton has been featured in multiple popular television and film productions, such as Mr. Robot, Knives Out, Sounds of Metal, and more.
  • Grow with us - We're one of Europe's fastest-growing startups, doubling in size every year. Our growth gives you limitless career and educational opportunities as well as the opportunity to work side-by-side with many world-leading experts in their fields.
  • Have your voice heard - We value your opinion and encourage you to speak up and share your ideas and thoughts. At Proton, no problem is someone else's problem. We collectively strive to do the right thing and be the undisputed best in the world at everything we do.
  • Benefits ‚Äì these vary by location and type of contract but expect support on your vacation, parental leave, refreshment if working from the office, learning and development opportunities, equity for shared success, flexible working hours, company events and team building activities.

 

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from a candidate. Proton will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited offer, even in a situation when the relevant candidate is employed by Proton.

YOUR MISSION:

As Senior Revenue Operations Manager (f/m/d)* you will design, develop, and maintain content, processes, and tooling that drive alignment and increase performance efficiencies across all commercial departments Growth, Marketing, Sales, Partnerships, Customer Success) and the entire Customer Lifecycle. The team will be responsible for the translation of strategic goals into actionable processes for the commercial teams with the goal of maximising our revenue potential.

data.title: Talent Community Germany
data.description:
About Us

At MorphoSys, we are driven by our mission: More life for people with cancer. As a global commercial-stage biopharmaceutical company, we develop and deliver innovative medicines, aspiring to redefine how cancer is treated.

Living up to the origin of our name ‚Äì Metamorphosis ‚Äì we transformed from a leading R&D partner into a fully integrated biopharmaceutical company. After nearly three decades in Germany, the doors to MorphoSys US opened in 2019 in Boston to launch our first breakthrough cancer immunotherapy, MONJUVI¬Æ (tafasitimab-cxix) in relapsed / refractory diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL).

Since then, we haven't slowed down. Adding to our leading R&D capabilities in Germany, a second global development hub opened in Boston to accelerate our US Commercial capabilities. In 2021, we expanded our portfolio with the acquisition of Constellation Pharmaceuticals, and we are continuing to emerge as a leader and future powerhouse in hematology-oncology. Grow with us.

MorphoSys is headquartered in Planegg, German and has its U.S. operations anchored in Boston, Massachusetts, offering colleagues flexible work models in all locations. The MorphoSys Group has more than 500 employees. For more information, visit www.MorphoSys.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.

data.title: Senior Business Development Representative (TIME) - DACH (m/f/d)
data.description:
Allow us to introduce ourselves

Hello there! We're Appinio, the fastest (and coolest) market research platform. On a mission to make the world a little more fact-based, we help companies understand how consumers think and make better data-driven decisions.

We started out in Hamburg back in 2014 but we're now humbled to call the world our playground, with over 200 employees spread across 25 cities (we're remote-first), 2000+ international clients and a panel reach of 7 million, globally.

Want to be a part of the Appinio movement? üöÄ

Your mission as a Senior Business Development Representative (TIME) - DACH

Appinio is looking for a rockstar Senior Business Development Representative (Telco, Innovation, Media/ Entertainment and Energy) - DACH to continue our strong growth track in this industry. As a Senior BDR, you are at the forefront of our journey to revolutionise the insights market and help to drive our expansion. As we continue to expand our presence in the TIME vertical, we are looking for smart, creative, passionate, sociable, and energetic people to drive growth in our ambitious team.

As a Senior BDR, you will be identifying, pursuing, and realizing growth opportunities and will specialize in our attractive TIME vertical. You will get support in building a relevant network in the vertical and positioning yourself as an industry expert. The Senior BDR position is your chance to kickstart your career in Sales and join one of Europe's fastest-growing & coolest companies.

What you'll be doing

  • Understanding industry dynamics and trends, identifying potential target customers, and uncovering the needs of target personas within relevant prospects
  • Drafting outbound strategies to approach potential target customers, craft and execute communication sequences 
  • Building up your deal pipeline and close deals with your own customers to develop into the role of a Junior Client Relations Manager
  • Guiding and developing Working Students once you're fully onboarded and well-equipped with all the tools and skills necessary to excel in your role
  • Creating and analyzing account maps to understand your target companies' structures and discover relevant decision-makers 
  • Collaborating across international teams to guarantee the best user experience for our clients 
  • Leading your qualification and nurture meetings with CEOs, CMOs, Head of Innovation, and other target personas supported by perfectly prepared meetings with your team 
  • Optimizing internal processes to make working methods more efficient (Our value: think 10x)

You will thrive in this role if

  • You are a native German speaker and fluent in English (written and spoken)
  • You have successfully completed your Apprenticeship (Ausbildung), Bachelor or Master and are extremely motivated to gain valuable experience within the area of sales, promoting one of the best products out there
  • You are a very sociable person, characterised by an open nature, which enables you to approach new people with ease
  • You are characterised by strong communication skills, excellent time management, a hands-on mentality, and an independent work behaviour
  • You like to work in a structured, strategical, and customer-oriented manner in an international and (semi)-remote environment
  • You are able to pick up tasks very quickly and execute them as efficient as possible
  • You feel comfortable getting challenged while challenging other colleagues during your day-to-day business (360-degree feedback & collaboration)
  • You consider yourself a smart, energetic, passionate, outgoing, creative and entrepreneurial personality
  • You are highly ambitious as well as a great team player
  • You ideally already have gathered knowledge about or experience in the Media & Entertainment industry and understand the customers needs

What's in it for you?

  • Flexibility Policy - meaning there is no hard cap on the number of vacation days
  • Work-from-anywhere Policy 
    • You have the chance to develop our amazing product in one of the countries where we operate: Spain, France, Germany, Portugal, the Netherlands or the UK.
    • You have the chance to work outside of your country of residence for a maximum of 180 days per year, given that you have a valid work permit for that country
  • Udemy L&D Platform - full access to 22,000+ courses and certifications to deepen your knowledge as your career progresses
  • You will have the chance to develop your skills with a Masterclass of SDRs of Germany
  • All the hardware you need and your own MacBook
  • In case you're located in Hamburg or Berlin, you'll get a Deutschlandticket or access to a mobility budget with the RYDES app to get you to and from the office space
  • In case you are located in Germany or Spain, you will have access to a Subsidized Urban Sports Club membership
  • In case you're located in one of the cities where most of our fellow Appinioneers are (Hamburg, Berlin, London, Madrid, New York), you can get access to our Co-working spaces

This post not only outlines our ideal candidate but also serves as an inspiration for what this role can evolve into. Even if you consider yourself an 80% fit but have a genuine passion for this position, we encourage you to apply. We're eager to hear from individuals who share our enthusiasm.

Appinio is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

Learn more about us:

data.title: Chief Manufacturing Engineer - Propulsion
data.description:
A career at Lilium is for those who want to do something extraordinary. We take pride in pushing the boundaries of engineering, technology and customer experience.  

As part of a team, you will tackle challenges and deliver something that has never been done before.‚ÄØBy joining Lilium you will have the opportunity to work with a world-class entrepreneurial team of more than‚ÄØ 950 people who are ‚ÄØas passionate about changing the world as you are.  

You will always act with safety and integrity in mind and embody our core behaviors of efficient and positive collaboration, ownership of time, continuous improvements and, ultimately delivering results.

We thrive on diversity and creating an inclusive culture, with more than 50 nationalities currently working hard to bring our vision of a sustainable world to life. 

Are you ready to be at the forefront of revolutionizing air mobility?   As we embark on the exciting journey towards serial production of our ground-breaking Lilium jet, we have an opportunity for a technically strong leader specializing in propulsion to take on a key role in our team!

Your‚ÄØrole‚ÄØand your‚ÄØteam:‚ÄØ 

As the technical voice of the manufacturing engineering product team, you will build strong partnerships with the Manufacturing Leadership organization.  Acting as the primary interface to our Technical Leads, IPTs, and Heads of Shops, and reporting directly to the CMO/ VP of Industrial Readiness. 

The technical lead and key relationship owner, you will be the subject matter expert (SME) during trade-off discussions and decision-making sessions and be the key liaison to Chief Engineering for manufacturability assessments from a material, methods, and cost perspective.‚ÄØ Representing the manufacturing community technically, you will confidently handle escalations and conflicts of interest from manufacturing engineers (MEs)  and promote good manufacturing engineering practices.  

Your Day to Day: 

  • Represent MEs and production in daily stand ups and priority meetings. 
  • Drive capability acquisition of new technologies, systems, and factories to establish a state-of-the-art manufacturing process 
  • Mentor your teammates as the resident expert for variety of manufacturing processes.   
  • Ensure technology development demonstrator roadmaps include manufacturing feasibility trials alongside design development 
  • Support design review and production readiness for the new products 

Your Profile: 

We are looking for a credible, experienced technical leader with an extensive expertise in propulsion gained within an automotive, aerospace or related manufacturing environment,   Demonstrated deep  involvement in 2 or more complete high-impact programs from start of design to post production is essential. 

A strong collaborator with proven decision-making and conflict resolution experience, adept at managing cross-functional relationships with teams like Design Engineering, Quality, Program Management, Procurement and navigating competing priorities. 

Key Requirements: 

  • Relevant Bachelors degree and a minimum of 10 to 15 years of experience in manufacturing engineering, supply chain quality, or industrial engineering relating to propulsion 
  • Excellent analytical capabilities with a drive to challenge the status quo.  Eager to learn; puts the team first; resilient with a passion for achieving mission objectives.  Accustomed to using failure as a learning tool and applying a high sense of urgency 
  • Hands-on mentality and heavy collaboration with production teams to secure continuous production flow‚ÄØ 

 

#LI-CG1

 

Want to know more? Then view our 'Why join Lilium' page!

Life at Lilium:

The wellbeing of our employees is a high priority. In our HQ we have many initiatives such as free healthy food and drinks, free in-house gym and health days. In remote offices we offer online opportunities to stay connected and develop yourself as well including our culture club, learning terminal, Employee Assistance Program and many more.

 Lilium is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

At STABL, immersing yourself in our culture means becoming a vital part of where efficiency and responsible practices converge, driving genuine transformation. Here‚Äôs what sets us apart:

  • Diversity and Inclusion: Join a diverse team where varied perspectives are not just welcomed but essential to fuel our drive for breakthroughs and success.
  • Work-Life Harmony: Enjoy flexible work arrangements and wellness initiatives designed to support your personal well-being.

By joining STABL, you're not just starting a job. You're contributing to a collective effort to advance energy solutions. Here, every role plays a part in steering the future of energy towards greater efficiency and responsibility.

data.title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer (F/M/D)
data.description:
OUR VISION

When people use our technology to "bridge the gap" between the physical and digital worlds, they don‚Äôt just capture reality - they create a new one. In this new reality, they are smarter, more productive, more streamlined, and more creative - because they have the digital foundation to build the world they want to live in.

That‚Äôs what NavVis offers in all our products and services: the tools to not just map the world as it is, but to pave the way to a better future. To forge something new. Physical or digital, there is only one reality. And it‚Äôs the reality NavVis empowers people to build better.

THE OPPORTUNITY

Do you want to design and implement the best possible solutions for the scaling our global IT Infrastructure?

As a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer, you will have the exciting opportunity to collaborate with our software engineering teams and take ownership of further improving our software development and delivery processes. You will simultaneously enjoy learning and further strengthening your skills in technologies like Ansible, Terraform, Kubernetes, Linux, AWS, and Microsoft 365.

Are you ready to join our team, tackle exciting challenges and bring NavVis IT Infrastructure to the next level?

HOW YOU WILL MAKE AN IMPACT

  • You will contribute significantly to the development of our scalable and reliable global infrastructure while ensuring the highest quality of our products
  • You will have the crucial responsibility of providing best-in-class security solutions for our enterprise customers
  • You will enable the improvement of the availability and maintenance of our platform services through automated tools and processes
  • You will have complete ownership of ensuring the continuous improvement of our monitoring and log collection infrastructure, enabling fast feedback and proactive capacity planning

WHAT WILL HELP YOU SUCCEED IN THE ROLE

  • Previous experience with major public cloud providers (ideally AWS), Kubernetes, as well as automation tools and infrastructure provisioning (Ansible, Terraform, etc)
  • Rock-solid knowledge of Linux Operating Systems
  • Some experience in shell scripting (Bash) and ideally a programming language such as Python or Go
  • A good understanding of DevOps / Site Reliability Engineering practices and their tools
  • Excellent communication skills in English
  • Initial experience creating a cloud infrastructure or deploying Kubernetes from scratch would be an added bonus

HOW WE WILL KNOW WE ARE A PERFECT MATCH

Your recruiting partner for this role is Rina (she/her). You can expect to go through a screening call, and up to 3 rounds of interviews, where we would love to discover your passion and interests, introduce you to who we are and what drives us, and finally understand how we can potentially add value to each other's growth.

HOW WE WILL KEEP YOU SMILING

    • It's important to take a break from work! We offer 30 days of paid time off per year
    • We offer flexible working hours and a hybrid work setup, enabling you to plan your work around your life, and not your life around work!
    • We offer full visa and relocation support for international candidates
    • An attractive bike leasing model through JobRad, in line with our commitment towards sustainable mobility
    • A competitive compensation package that values the skills and experience you bring
    • Up to 4000 EUR employee referral bonus
    • Financial support for local language classes to help you in your journey of integrating into the culture!

ABOUT US

NavVis is a technologically-focused, global leader in reality capture and digital factory solutions. Prominent manufacturers and laser scanning professionals from across the world trust our ground-breaking technology, which is designed to capture and share the built environment as photorealistic digital twins.

More than 300 people from over 70 countries and offices spread around the globe make us a truly international and diverse place to work. With the innovation of startups and the stability of large enterprises at our core, we combine the best of both worlds.

You will be part of an open culture that encourages the sharing of ideas and thrives on mutual trust, respect, and transparency. We love giving and receiving honest feedback that will empower us to continuously improve and grow in the right direction.

Do you share our passion for our disruptive technology and want to be a part of our dynamic growth journey? You will get to own projects, implement innovative solutions, and be recognized for your successes!

How you will grow with us

  • Flat hierarchy with an open feedback culture, including 360¬∞ developmental feedback aimed at holistic professional development
  • Access to a learning & developmental platform with trainings tailored to your needs on a broad range of topics
